Deep Neural Network TypeScript Implementation

First, you have the option to draw a number between 0 and 9, or to generate a random hand-drawn number from the mnist database. You can then choose one of two pre-learned networks and see, if they can calculate your number. The 1x20 network consists of 1 hidden layer with 20 nodes, while the 2x16 network is made up of 2 hidden layers with 16 nodes each. Both have 784 input nodes (1 for each pixel of a 28x28 image) and 10 output nodes (one for each digit).

For further info, visit my Blog Post or get the source on GitHub.
